leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 计算系统生物学与动力学生态
leaf_cluster.typical_objects: ODE/PDE 模型, 代谢网络, 信号通路, 参数与不确定性
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 建模→参数估计→仿真→敏感性/UQ→反演→验证
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 建模语言/仿真器 + 参数估计/UQ + 数据拟合工作流

unit.unit_name: 系统生物学建模语言与模型表示（SBML等）

tools.name: sbml2cellml
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML) to CellML format
tools.detailed_description: A Ruby-based utility program designed to convert biological models defined in SBML format into CellML format, facilitating interoperability between these two major systems biology standards.

tools.name: AutoKEGGRec
tools.one_line_profile: Automated metabolic network reconstruction tool using KEGG data
tools.detailed_description: An automated tool implemented in MATLAB that creates draft metabolic network reconstructions for single organisms or communities based on KEGG database information, supporting the generation of consolidated reconstructions.

tools.name: PathSBML
tools.one_line_profile: PathVisio plugin for importing SBML models as SBGN diagrams
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the pathway analysis tool PathVisio that allows users to import SBML models and visualize them as SBGN-PD (Systems Biology Graphical Notation - Process Description) diagrams.

tools.name: Paxtools
tools.one_line_profile: Java library for the BioPAX biological pathway exchange standard
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Java library providing an object model, API, and utilities for manipulating, validating, and querying BioPAX data, a standard language for biological pathway exchange.

tools.name: paxtoolsr
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for BioPAX pathway analysis and Paxtools
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides functions to interact with BioPAX OWL files using Paxtools and to query the Pathway Commons molecular interaction database.

tools.name: SBML.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia interface to the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML)
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing an interface to the libSBML library, allowing users to read, write, and manipulate SBML models directly within the Julia programming environment.

tools.name: pyvipr
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization widget for systems biology models in Jupyter
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool providing static and dynamic visualizations for systems biology models (PySB, BNGL, SBML) within Jupyter notebooks, aiding in model debugging and communication.

tools.name: iBioSim
tools.one_line_profile: CAD tool for modeling and design of genetic circuits
tools.detailed_description: A computer-aided design (CAD) tool for the modeling, analysis, and design of genetic circuits, with support for importing/exporting SBML and SBOL standards.

tools.name: PEtab
tools.one_line_profile: Data format and library for parameter estimation in systems biology
tools.detailed_description: A repository defining the PEtab standard for specifying parameter estimation problems in systems biology (based on SBML and TSV), including Python libraries and validators for the format.

tools.name: ChiBE
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and analysis tool for BioPAX pathways
tools.detailed_description: A desktop application for visualizing, querying, and analyzing biological pathways and networks represented in the BioPAX format, often used with Pathway Commons data.

tools.name: cytoscape-sbgn-stylesheet
tools.one_line_profile: Cytoscape.js stylesheet for SBGN visualization
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library providing a Cytoscape.js stylesheet to render biological networks according to the Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN) standard.

tools.name: sbgnml-to-cytoscape
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from SBGN-ML to Cytoscape.js JSON
tools.detailed_description: An npm module and utility for converting Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN) XML files into JSON format compatible with Cytoscape.js for web-based visualization.

tools.name: CellMLToolkit.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for CellML model simulation and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library that connects CellML models to the Scientific Julia ecosystem (SciML), enabling high-performance simulation and analysis of physiological models.

tools.name: cobrar
tools.one_line_profile: Constraint-based reconstruction and analysis of metabolic networks in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package for the constraint-based reconstruction and analysis (COBRA) of metabolic networks, providing tools for flux balance analysis and network manipulation.

tools.name: Antimony
tools.one_line_profile: A modular human-readable model definition language for systems biology
tools.detailed_description: The reference implementation (library and parser) for Antimony, a text-based, human-readable language designed for defining and modularizing systems biology models.

tools.name: BioSimulations
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for sharing and reusing biomodeling studies
tools.detailed_description: A web platform and associated tools for sharing, visualizing, and simulating biological models, promoting reproducibility in systems biology research.

tools.name: BioSimulators
tools.one_line_profile: Registry and standard interface for biosimulation tools
tools.detailed_description: A registry and set of utilities for containerized biosimulation tools that adhere to a standard command-line interface, facilitating the execution of diverse biological simulations.

tools.name: Biosimulators_test_suite
tools.one_line_profile: Validation suite for BioSimulators standards
tools.detailed_description: A utility tool for validating that biosimulation software tools correctly implement the BioSimulators standards and command-line interfaces.

tools.name: rust_sbml
tools.one_line_profile: SBML parser and Python bindings in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A Rust-based parser for the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML) that includes bindings for Python, offering a high-performance alternative for reading SBML files.

tools.name: libCellML
tools.one_line_profile: Reference implementation of the CellML model description language
tools.detailed_description: The core C++ library for creating, manipulating, and validating CellML models, serving as the reference implementation for the CellML standard.

tools.name: CellML API
tools.one_line_profile: Legacy API for working with CellML models
tools.detailed_description: An application programming interface and implementation for working with CellML models, providing tools for model manipulation and code generation (Note: largely superseded by libCellML but historically significant).

tools.name: libSBGN.js
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for parsing and writing SBGN format
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library designed to parse and write Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN) files, enabling web-based tools to handle standard biological network representations.

tools.name: EscherConverter
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for Escher metabolic maps to standard formats
tools.detailed_description: A standalone program that converts files created with the Escher graphical network editor into community standard formats like SBML, facilitating the integration of visualization data with simulation workflows.

tools.name: KEGGtranslator
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for translating KEGG pathways to BioPAX and SBML
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based software for visualizing and translating the KEGG PATHWAY database, converting KGML files into BioPAX, SBML, GraphML, and other formats for systems biology modeling.

tools.name: SBML2LaTeX
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from SBML models to LaTeX reports
tools.detailed_description: A tool to convert Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML) files into LaTeX documents, allowing for the generation of human-readable PDF reports for model documentation, error detection, and proofreading.

tools.name: SBSCL
tools.one_line_profile: Systems Biology Simulation Core Library
tools.detailed_description: A Java implementation of methods to interpret and numerically solve models encoded in the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML), serving as a core library for simulation applications.

tools.name: SBTabEditor
tools.one_line_profile: Editor for SBML files using SBTab format
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform JavaFX application for reading, writing, manipulating, and validating SBML files, utilizing the SBTab tabular format for easier model data management.

tools.name: pymCADRE
tools.one_line_profile: Reconstruction of tissue-specific metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation enabling the reconstruction of tissue-specific metabolic models using transcriptomic data and network topology information, based on the mCADRE algorithm.

tools.name: CoReCo
tools.one_line_profile: Comparative reconstruction of metabolic networks
tools.detailed_description: A computational method for the Comparative ReConstruction of genome-scale metabolic networks, leveraging sequence data to infer metabolic capabilities across species.

tools.name: CombineArchive
tools.one_line_profile: Library for accessing COMBINE archives
tools.detailed_description: Libraries and tools for creating, reading, and manipulating COMBINE archives, a standard format for packaging systems biology models, simulation descriptions, and associated data.

tools.name: libSEDML
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for SED-ML support
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for reading, writing, and manipulating files in the Simulation Experiment Description Markup Language (SED-ML) format, based on the libSBML architecture.

tools.name: Flint
tools.one_line_profile: Simulator for biological and physiological models
tools.detailed_description: A simulator designed for biological and physiological models, supporting standards like PHML and SBML to execute complex physiological simulations.

tools.name: rBiopaxParser
tools.one_line_profile: R package for parsing BioPAX files
tools.detailed_description: An R package that parses BioPAX files (supporting versions 2 and 3) and represents them within the R environment, enabling statistical analysis and visualization of biological pathways.

tools.name: pathways2GO
tools.one_line_profile: Converter between BioPAX and GO-CAM
tools.detailed_description: Code for converting between BioPAX pathway data and Gene Ontology Causal Activity Models (GO-CAM), facilitating the integration of pathway information with GO annotations.

tools.name: g2f
tools.one_line_profile: R package for gap-filling metabolic networks
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to identify and fill gaps in metabolic networks using stoichiometric reactions from a reference reconstruction and a weighting function.

tools.name: pybiopax
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of the BioPAX object model
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing a full implementation of the BioPAX object model, allowing for the programmatic creation, manipulation, and analysis of BioPAX pathway data.

tools.name: chise.js
tools.one_line_profile: Web application for SBGN pathway visualization and editing
tools.detailed_description: A web-based application to visualize and edit pathway models represented by the SBGN Process Description Notation, supporting interactive graph manipulation.

tools.name: cytoscape.js-layout-service
tools.one_line_profile: Layout service for Cytoscape.js graphs
tools.detailed_description: A web service designed to provide graph layout algorithms for Cytoscape.js, facilitating the automated arrangement of biological networks in web applications.

tools.name: newt
tools.one_line_profile: Web application for SBGN pathway modeling
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive web application for visualizing and editing biological pathway models, specifically supporting the SBGN standard for process descriptions.

tools.name: sbgnviz.js
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization library for SBGN maps
tools.detailed_description: A web-based visualization library for rendering Process Description maps in the Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN), enabling integration of pathway views into web tools.

tools.name: PanGEM
tools.one_line_profile: Pangenome-scale metabolic network reconstruction toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for pangenome-scale metabolic network reconstruction, analysis, and the extraction of strain-specific models from a pangenome reference.

tools.name: momba
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for quantitative formal models (JANI)
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox for dealing with formal models, particularly those in the JANI interchange format, supporting construction, manipulation, and analysis of quantitative models often used in stochastic systems biology.

tools.name: libsbmljs
tools.one_line_profile: WebAssembly/JavaScript SBML library
tools.detailed_description: A WebAssembly-based JavaScript library that provides SBML processing capabilities in the browser, enabling high-performance model parsing and manipulation in web applications.

tools.name: libsbmlsim
tools.one_line_profile: Library for simulating SBML models
tools.detailed_description: A C library designed for simulating models encoded in SBML, providing a lightweight and efficient engine for numerical integration of biological systems.

tools.name: Sedov-ML
tools.one_line_profile: ML for predicting physics variables in Sedov blast simulation
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning project for predicting physics variables in Sedov blast wave simulations, demonstrating the application of AI surrogates in fluid dynamics and physics simulations.

tools.name: libsbgnpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for SBGN
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for reading, writing, and manipulating Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN) files, facilitating the development of Python-based tools for pathway visualization.

tools.name: pymetadata
tools.one_line_profile: Python utilities for COMBINE archive metadata
tools.detailed_description: Python utilities for working with metadata and COMBINE archives, supporting the annotation and management of systems biology models to ensure reproducibility.

tools.name: sbmlutils
tools.one_line_profile: Python utilities for SBML
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python utilities for working with SBML models, providing helper functions for model creation, manipulation, and simulation setup.

tools.name: swiftcore
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated metabolic network reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A tool that accelerates genome-scale metabolic network reconstruction by using convex optimization techniques such as factorization and regularization.

tools.name: Medusa
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis of ensembles of metabolic network reconstructions
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for the generation and analysis of ensembles of genome-scale metabolic network reconstructions, allowing researchers to account for uncertainty in network structure.

tools.name: OpenCOR
tools.one_line_profile: Modelling environment for CellML
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform modelling environment designed to organise, edit, simulate, and analyse CellML files, providing a comprehensive workspace for physiological modeling.

tools.name: GPRuler
tools.one_line_profile: Reconstruction of Gene-Protein-Reaction rules
tools.detailed_description: An open-source computational framework to automate the reconstruction process of Gene-Protein-Reaction (GPR) rules within metabolic networks, linking genomic data to metabolic reactions.

tools.name: sbml2hyb
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for SBML compatible hybrid modelling
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to facilitate hybrid modelling of biological systems while maintaining compatibility with the SBML standard, allowing for the integration of discrete and continuous modeling approaches.

tools.name: SBML_odeSolver
tools.one_line_profile: C library for symbolic and numerical analysis of ODEs derived from SBML models
tools.detailed_description: A C library designed to perform symbolic and numerical analysis on systems of ordinary differential equations (ODEs) that are derived from chemical reaction networks encoded in the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML). It supports simulation and analysis of biological dynamics.

tools.name: libsbgn
tools.one_line_profile: Library for reading, writing, and manipulating SBGN (Systems Biology Graphical Notation) files
tools.detailed_description: A library providing support for the Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN), a standard for visualizing biological networks. It enables developers to read, write, and validate SBGN files in Java and C++ applications.

tools.name: ySBGN
tools.one_line_profile: Converter between GraphML (yED) and SBGN-ML formats
tools.detailed_description: A utility tool that facilitates the translation between GraphML format (used by the yED graph editor) and SBGN-ML, allowing researchers to design biological networks in yED and convert them to the standard SBGN format.

tools.name: deviser
tools.one_line_profile: Design Explorer and Viewer for Iterative SBML Enhancement
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for exploring and viewing SBML models, aiding in the iterative enhancement of model representations. It serves as a visual interface for inspecting model structures in systems biology.

tools.name: JSBML
tools.one_line_profile: Pure Java library for reading, writing, and manipulating SBML files
tools.detailed_description: A community-driven, pure Java library for processing Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML) files. It provides a comprehensive API for reading, writing, and manipulating SBML data structures, serving as an alternative to the JNI-based libSBML bindings.

tools.name: libCombine
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for working with the COMBINE Archive format
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library implementing support for the COMBINE Archive format (OMEX), which is used to bundle systems biology models, simulation descriptions, and associated data into a single file for exchange and reproducibility.

tools.name: libSBML
tools.one_line_profile: Standard native library for reading, writing, and manipulating SBML files
tools.detailed_description: The reference implementation library for the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML). It provides APIs for reading, writing, validating, and manipulating SBML models, with bindings for multiple programming languages including C, C++, Python, Java, and MATLAB.

tools.name: python-libsbml
tools.one_line_profile: Python bindings for libSBML to handle SBML models
tools.detailed_description: A standalone Python package providing the libSBML interface. It allows Python developers to read, write, validate, and manipulate SBML Level 3 Core and package extensions for systems biology modeling.

tools.name: Spatial Model Editor
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial bio-chemical reaction model editor and simulator
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for creating, editing, and simulating spatial biochemical reaction models. It supports the definition of geometry and reaction kinetics, enabling the study of spatial dynamics in biological systems.

tools.name: simpleSBML
tools.one_line_profile: Simplified Python interface for building SBML models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides a simplified, high-level interface for constructing SBML models. It abstracts away the complexity of the full libSBML API, making it easier for researchers to script model generation.

tools.name: Chimera
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for genome-based metabolic network reconstruction and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline tool designed for the reconstruction, evaluation, and visualization of metabolic networks based on genomic data. It facilitates the creation of genome-scale metabolic models (GEMs).

tools.name: SBtab
tools.one_line_profile: Tools and format definition for table-based systems biology data
tools.detailed_description: A project defining the SBtab format, which uses spreadsheet-like tables to represent systems biology models and data. The repository typically includes specifications and utility scripts for handling this format.

tools.name: krayon4sbgn
tools.one_line_profile: Editor for SBGN diagrams based on yFiles
tools.detailed_description: A graphical editor for creating and modifying Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN) diagrams. It is built using Kotlin and the yFiles library, providing a user-friendly interface for biological network visualization.
